Job Title: Communications Manager

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Belong. Believe. Be You. Belden.

Propel your career surrounded by a diverse team of innovative, goal-oriented individuals who are pursuing the next generation of connectivity solutions. At Belden, you’ll participate in work that will challenge you and position you to excel. You’ll collaborate with colleagues from around the world, gaining exposure to a broad base of expertise and perspectives.

Together, we’ll continue on a journey of innovation, creating a connected world and paving the way for automation. Join us and let’s build the future.

The Communications Manager will be part of a team providing global communication support that spans our diverse international footprint and workforce. This role with report to the VP of Corporate Communications and will work in a hybrid capacity at our Indianapolis, IN facility.

Responsibilities:

Be able to think strategically, understand the complex Belden strategy, make recommendations to the business leaders on appropriate communication tactics, and ensure messaging is consistent across the organization.Support implementation of tactics and measurement of success for a variety of business initiatives and communication objectives.Write and edit communications and assist in executing campaigns for various teams such as executive leadership, business updates, strategy, etc.Summarize and write powerful key messaging that inspires action.Utilize Salesforce for internal email communications.Coordinate between social media and marketing as needed for consistent messaging internally and externally.Research and update SharePoint pages on global intranet site for employee use.Follow Belden’s brand identity guide when developing print and web-based internal communications and presentations.

Required Skills And Experience

5 or more years of corporate communications experience, preferably for a global publicly traded companyBachelor’s degree in a field such as communications, journalism, public relations or a related fieldStrong business writing skills (provide samples upon request)Ability to build relationships and influence while supporting cross-functional needsAbility to maintain the highest level of confidentiality and professionalismAbility to think strategically as well as operate at a tactical levelSolid business and communications acumen, creativity and analytical skillsStrong project management skills, comfort with ambiguity and excitement for fast-paced atmosphereAbility to meet tight deadlines when neededOccasional business travel required

Let’s Write the Next 100 Years Together. 

Join a global community striving to improve connectivity and security. The work we’re doing puts our people on the front lines of impacting lives and shaping the future. Propel your story of innovation by helping Belden write the next chapter in ours. Shape your future at Belden.

These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work involved for this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of this job.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
